DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate safety effectiveness oxcarbazepine ( Trileptal ) add-on therapy treatment partial seizure pediatric patient 1 month 3 year age .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : To enter study , patient must : Have diagnosis partial seizure Be willing hospitalize Weigh minimum 6.6 pound Be take stable dose one two concomitant antiepileptic medication Have previous CAT scan/MRI confirm absence space occupy lesion progressive neurological disease Have normal laboratory result EXCLUSION CRITERIA : To enter study , patient must : Seizures cause metabolic disturbance , toxic exposure , active infection A primary diagnosis generalize epilepsy ( exception secondarily generalize seizure ) A history status epilepticus within 30 day Seizures relate epilepsy Frequent use additional antiepileptic medication treat increase seizure ( example : rectal diazepam ) Taking felbamate within 6 month Serum sodium level < 135 mEq/L Significant heart , breathing , kidney , stomach , liver , blood , cancer disorder require treatment/therapy A history chronic infection ( e.g. , hepatitis HIV ) Significant electrocardiogram ( ECG ) abnormalities A nursing mother take anticonvulsant drug Previously demonstrate sensitivity/allergic reaction Trileptal related compound Used experimental medication within 30 day enter study
